app.title: VITA - Video Editor & Maker
app.description:
VITA is a simple & easy video editing app with all features you need for videography!
Start creating amazing videos with all the high-quality features in VITA.

- Export videos in full HD quality.
- Speed up & add slow motion with the video speed option.
- Add video transitions to make your videos look more cinematic.
- Make aesthetic videos with dreamy glitch, glitter, and bling effects.
- Apply filters to your videos for color grading.
- Select songs from the music library to enrich your videos.
- Create your own vlogs with quick and easy video templates.
- Use pre-made fonts and animated texts & customize with strokes, shadows, and colors.
- Collage and overlay videos with PIP to make clone videos.

app.summary: VITA is a simple video editing app with trendy content.

reviews.text: This app is perfect. Some many things you can do to make: videos, edit videos, make picture show/ videos it's awesome. The effects and templates are wonder and easy to use. Anyone can easily create master piece with your memories to last forever. I make videos from still photos that I give movement to and all the bling, effects, bells and whistles I add with this app. Sound effect and music as well. The best part is IT'S ALL FREE! NO PRO FEATURES TO BUY!!! YES! DOWNLOAD TODAY!üíñüíØüíú don't wait

So after a year I wanted to come and edit my review. I love VITA but let me be clear if you are trying to do a long video for like Youtube, etc don't use this. This editor is more for shorter vids. (At least that's the ones that come out the best for me) some of their transits are basic if you compare it to other apps but you also gotta pay for other apps. So for a free app that does EVERYTHING it is a very useful tool. I recommend it! But there is not a lookup option for like transitions etc~

It has a great amount of effects, filters, and options for subtitles. The amount of ads are minimal, and you hardly have to pay for anything. The only negative about this app is that it takes a long time to export videos that are heavily edited. I wouldn't use this for anything longer than three minutes really. Cut any long video you want into small clips, and combine it using a different apps for the best result.

Good editing app, but there's plenty of problems. 1, the length of adding a pip layer disappears when you extend it. 2, hard to find music could you add like a search icon on a device? 3, poor optimization and it lags so quickly. 4, the audio sometimes distorted. 5, after exporting a video, the audio is unsynced and it is really annoying. hope you could fix it update: also the clips are doubled and repeated from the start on the end of the clip pls fix it

so far, it's giving me a lot of hope that I've found a good editing app after capcut turned pro. Wish there was more shake effects, keyframes and be able to disable the milliseconds things because it's kinda annoying. Also the mark for beat button is NOT fast, which doesn't help when editing to very fast audio. Sometimes, even if there's only one finger touching the screen, it randomly zooms in. it has great potential but needs a bit more polishing. More effects, transitions, and its all good

It is Excellent... Some improvements are required... For selection of music option for browsing should be available instead of showing all the music files together. ‡™∏‡´ç‡™•‡´Ç‡™≥ the system of browsing music needs improvement. Recently gif is suddenly removed. Pl restore it. Very nice. But still having issue with gif. Please fix the bug

It work quite well most times, but the music doesn't seem to work. I was trying to edit a video, and when I added music, I wanted to play it to make sure it was good before posting. When I tryed to play it, there was no music. I tryed downloading a song and I had to sync the music. For some reason, it only download the first twenty seconds of the song. I tried downloading it again in case I had made a mistake, but it didn't work. Thank you for your time‚ù§Ô∏è Have an amazing day

Amazing editing app for when you need to edit small videos. I love how easy it is to use and looking at different editing apps, this is definitely the better and free alternative. The biggest problem I've encounteter however is the lack of keyframes for main clips and graphs. I hoped to be able to use graphs on keyframes but was sadly disappointed.

üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü 5/5 Absolutely love the VITA editing app! It‚Äôs user-friendly, fast, and packed with powerful features. Whether it‚Äôs slow motion, transitions, filters, or adding music, everything is super easy‚Äîeven for beginners. The templates are stylish and modern, making every video look professional. Perfect for Instagram, YouTube, or reels. Highly recommended for anyone who wants high-quality editing on their phone.

I'm LOVING this app! It has so many cool features!! But the only problem i have with it is the fact that i can't exit/close the app when my video is saving, because i can't do anything on my phone, except to wait for it to finish loading/saving & i hate having to leave my phone on because it heat's up & all, especially when i need to charge it or when it IS, on charge & possibly ruins my phone battery. So please allow us to close the app while our videos are saving, Thank You!

app.AIReview:
VITA - Video Editor & Maker Review

Overview

VITA ‚Äì Video Editor & Maker boasts an impressive 141,068,579 total installs and a solid 4.33 rating from over 892,200 users, placing it firmly within the top tier of video editing apps available on mobile platforms. The app‚Äôs core promise ‚Äì ‚Äúa simple & easy video editing app with all features you need for videography!‚Äù ‚Äì aligns with the current trend towards user-friendly creative tools catering to a broad audience, particularly those creating content for social media like TikTok and Instagram Reels. The free price point is undoubtedly a significant draw, making it accessible to nearly everyone. However, success in this competitive market hinges on delivering a genuinely useful editing experience without sacrificing quality or overwhelming users with complex controls. This review assesses VITA against these criteria, analyzing its functionality, user interface, and overall value proposition.

Key Features

VITA's feature set is designed for the modern content creator, offering a range of tools categorized as follows:

  • Video Speed Control: Users can adjust video speed to create slow-motion or time-lapse effects with granular control.
  • Transition Effects: A selection of cinematic transitions are available ‚Äì likely including fades, wipes, and potentially more stylized options - allowing for seamless blending between clips.
  • Glitch & Special Effects: The app includes a collection of trendy aesthetic filters like ‚Äúdreamy glitch, glitter, and bling‚Äù effects aimed at creating visually striking content. These effects seem designed to appeal to the current trends on platforms like TikTok.
  • Color Grading Filters: Standard color grading options are present, allowing users to adjust brightness, contrast, saturation, and shadows for improved video quality and stylistic choices.
  • Music Library Integration: VITA offers a built-in music library, enabling users to easily add background music to their videos without the need for external audio files (though limitations on song selection or licensing should be considered).
  • Full HD Export: Videos can be exported in full HD quality, ensuring suitable resolution for sharing across various social media platforms.
  • Clip Editing & Sequencing: Basic tools for cutting and arranging clips within a timeline are included, forming the core of any video editing workflow.

Strengths

  • Ease of Use: VITA‚Äôs primary strength lies in its intuitive interface. The app is designed to be accessible even to users with no prior video editing experience. The simplified controls and clear visual layout contribute significantly to this user-friendly design.
  • Trendy Effects Library: The inclusion of glitch, glitter, and bling effects directly addresses the demand for visually dynamic content prevalent on platforms like TikTok and Instagram Reels. These features are likely a key driver behind the app's popularity.
  • High Export Quality: Supporting full HD export is crucial for maintaining video quality when sharing online and ensures that videos look professional.
  • Large User Base & Positive Rating: The substantial number of installs and high rating indicate significant user satisfaction ‚Äì suggesting VITA effectively meets the needs of a large segment of its audience.

Areas for Improvement

  • Limited Transition Options: While transition effects are present, the selection feels somewhat basic compared to competing apps offering more sophisticated transitions. Expanding this library would significantly enhance creative possibilities.
  • Music Library Quality & Licensing: The quality and variety within the integrated music library needs careful consideration. More importantly, navigating music licensing agreements for user-generated content is a significant challenge that VITA needs to address proactively.
  • Advanced Editing Features Absence: For a "full" video editing app, VITA lacks advanced features such as multi-track audio editing, precise keyframe animation, and more granular control over effects parameters. This limits its appeal for users seeking professional-level editing capabilities.
  • Performance on Lower-End Devices: Given the number of features packed into the app, performance may suffer on older or less powerful mobile devices. Optimization is crucial to ensure smooth playback and editing.

User Experience

The user experience in VITA is generally positive, particularly for beginners. The interface is clean, uncluttered, and easy to navigate. Importing clips is straightforward, and the timeline-based editing workflow feels intuitive. Drag-and-drop functionality for arranging clips streamlines the process. However, as projects become more complex (adding multiple transitions or effects), the app can feel slightly sluggish, particularly when exporting high-resolution videos. The tutorial could be improved to better explain advanced features beyond basic trimming and adding music.

Value for Money

At a free price point, VITA offers exceptional value. It provides a surprisingly comprehensive set of tools for creating engaging video content, making it a viable alternative to paid apps for casual users and hobbyists. The absence of in-app purchases focused solely on premium effects or features further enhances its appeal. However, the limitations outlined above ‚Äì particularly concerning advanced editing capabilities and potentially restrictive music licensing ‚Äì may eventually motivate some users to explore more feature-rich (and likely paid) alternatives.

Conclusion

VITA ‚Äì Video Editor & Maker successfully delivers a user-friendly video editing experience targeted at social media content creators. Its strengths lie in its intuitive interface, trendy effect library, and free price point. While it lacks advanced features and faces challenges with performance optimization, the app‚Äôs high install numbers and positive rating demonstrate its value to a large audience. It's an excellent starting point for anyone new to video editing but may not satisfy experienced users or those requiring professional-grade tools. The continued development of the music library and potential expansion of the transition effects would further solidify VITA‚Äôs position as a leading mobile video editor.
